ygData.subject: Re: cantera 1.7.1
ygData.msgSnippet: David, The main problem that I met is in my attempt to use a fixed temperature profile in a premixed flat burner flame in matlab. I tried to write the script

David, 
The main problem that I met is in my attempt to use a fixed
tempera=
ture profile in a premixed flat burner flame in matlab. I tried
to write th=
e script which is similar to the your python demo
"fixed_T_flame.py" using =
setFixedTempProfile.m function from matlab
toolbox. I could not see any eff=
ect of this function. Is it working?

I also found two small problems in fl=
ame2.py and fixed_T_flame.py.
These scripts give a segmentation fault, they=
 works if you comment
"f.setTimeStep(1.0e-5,[1,2,5,10,20]) line".
Regards.
=
Sergey. 


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wro=
te:
>
> Sergey,
> 
> The bugs you found have now been fixed, and the CVS re=
pository  
> updated.  Please let me know if there are still any problems.
=
> 
> Dave
> 
> 
> On May 11, 2007, at 10:13 AM, scheskis wrote:
> 
> > Hell=
o David,
> > I successfully installed Cantera 1.7.1 on suse 10.2 both 32 an=
d 64
> > bit. At the moment I have checked only the matlab demo.
> > Some p=
roblems:
> > 1. I was need to turn off "boost" option. They was on in CVS v=
ersion
> > which I downloaded today. In spite that I have boost instaled it=
 gaves
> > the following error:
> >
> > g++ -pthread -shared build/temp.lin=
ux-x86_64-2.5/src/pycantera.o
> > -L/home/sergey/src/cantera171/cantera/bui=
ld/lib/x86_64-unknown- 
> > linux-gnu
> > -L/usr/lib64 -L/home/sergey/sundi=
als/lib -L/usr/local/lib
> > -L/usr/lib/python2.5/config -lclib -luser -lon=
eD -lzeroD -lequil
> > -lkinetics -ltransport -lthermo -lctnumerics -lsundi=
als_cvodes
> > -lsundials_nvecserial -lctbase -llapack -lblas -lctmath -ltp=
x -lctf2c
> > -lconverters -lboost_thread-mt-1_34 -lctf2c -lctf2c -lm -lpyt=
hon2.5 -o
> > build/lib.linux-x86_64-2.5/Cantera/_cantera.so
> > /usr/lib64=
/gcc/x86_64-suse-linux/4.1.2/../../../../x86_64-suse- 
> > linux/bin/ld:
> =
> cannot find -lboost_thread-mt-1_34
> > collect2: ld returned 1 exit statu=
s
> >
> > 2. It is possible to compile only with f2c option. Using g77 or
>=
 > gfortran  gives undefined symbols: printstring_ for g77
> > or_gfortran_=
stop_numeric.
> >
> > 3. Problem with f2c was in the 64 bit version: I was =
needed to add
> > manually -fPIC in CFLAGS in all makefiles in etc subdirec=
tories:
> > f2c_math, f2c_lapack, etc. There is probably the better way to =
do it.
> > But after this change all is working.

.

> > --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@>=
 wrote:
> >>
> >> Cantera 1.7.1 is ready to be checked out from CVS for uni=
x/linux/Mac
> >> users. It is probably best to check out a fresh working co=
py, rather
> >> than update an existing one. The new features are:
> >>
> >=
> 1. Thread safe build option.  Cantera can optionally be built to be
> >> =
thread safe, which insures that static data (e.g. cached error
> >> message=
s) are modified by only one thread at a time. This option
> >> requires the=
 Boost thread library (which is why it is not the
> >> default).  You can d=
ownload Boost from www.boost.org.
> >>
> >> 2. Faster chemical equilibrium.=
 The equilibrium routines were
> >> spending quite a bit of time writing de=
tailed logfiles. Now this can
> >> be turned off, or completely compiled ou=
t of the code.
> >>
> >> Both of these options may be set in the preconfig =
script. Please
> >> report any build problems with this new version.
> >>
>=
 >
> >
